basics.name: Will Morrison
basics.label: Software Developer
basics.summary: Computer Science senior at Boston College with a minor in Management & Leadership. Graduating in May 2025 with a strong foundation in software development. Proficient in multiple programming languages and frameworks. Seeking a software engineering role to leverage my knowledge and project experience.

work.name: BoreDM
work.summary: BoreDM is "the modern standard for geotechnical and environmental subsurface data management."
highlights: Led the development and integration of SAML-based single sign-on (SSO) for BoreDM's web application
Developed a number of features that are now in use by BoreDM's customers, including laboratory tests, optimizations to the websocket system, and improvements to an LLM-based analysis module
Contract extended so that I could continue to work while I finish my degree

work.name: Boston College
work.summary: Worked as a research assistant for two professors and as a teaching assistant for three computer science courses.
highlights: Developed an Electron UI for ND2 image file transformations under Professor Donglai Wei
Developed and benchmarked distributed systems under Professor Lewis Tseng
Served as a Teaching Assistant for CS 2, Computer Systems, and Computer Networks for a total of 4 semesters
Led the development of a VR data visualization project under Professor Nam Wook Kim

work.name: EigenX
work.summary: Worked directly with clients, designing and writing software to fit their needs.
highlights: Collaborated with clients to understand and fulfill their software requirements
Designed and developed custom software solutions
Wrote applications with a variety of technologies including PostgreSQL, TypeScript, Salesforce, Python, Git, and Linux

volunteer.summary: Created interactive, educational math games in Unity.
Trained and socialized puppies to become guide dogs for the blind.

courses: 338901 - Topics in Computer Systems: Blockchain and Consensus Systems

projects.name: Auger
projects.description: An open-source TCP forwarding tool written in Go
highlights: Forwards local TCP traffic to a remote server
Runs as both a CLI app and on a server

projects.name: Eagle Monitor
projects.description: A web application for monitoring the status of Boston College's course registration system
highlights: Notifies users when a course they want to take has an open seat
Better search functionality than the official BC course registration system
